gurmukhi: cwgVdMg caukw hwgVdMg hnvMqw ] jwgVdMg joDw mhwN qyj mMqw ]
transliteration: Chaagaddan Chaoukaa Baagaddan Hanvantaa|| Jaagaddan Jodhaa Mahaan Tej Manta||
translation: The highly radiant Hanuman, seeing this, was perturbed and felt confused about the herb to be taken away;

gurmukhi: AwgVdMg auKwrw pwgVdMg phwrM ] AwgVdMg lY AauKDI ko isDwrM ]584]
transliteration: Aagaddan Oukhaaraa Paagaddan Pahaaran|| Aagaddan Lai Aoukhakhiko Sidhaaran||584||
translation: He uprooted the whole mountain and returned with the medicinal herbs.584.

gurmukhi: AwgVdMg Awey jhw rwm KyqM ] bwgVdMg bIrM jhwN qy AcyqM ]
transliteration: Aagaddan Aae Jahaa Raam Khetan|| Baagaddan Bderan Jahaan Te Achetan||
translation: He reached that battlefield with the mountain where Lakshman was lying unconscious;

gurmukhi: bwgVdMg ibs`lXw mwgVdMg mu`KM ] fwgVdMg fwrI swgVdMg su`KM ]585]
transliteration: Baagaddan Bisallyaa Maagaddan Moukkhan|| Daagaddan Daarisaagaddan Soukkhan||585||
translation: The apothecary Sushan put the required herb in the month of Lakshman.585.

gurmukhi: jwgVdMg jwgy swgVdMg sUrM ] GwgVdMg Gu`mI hwgVdMg hUrM ]
transliteration: Jaagaddan Jaage Saagaddan Sooran|| Ghaagaddan Ghoummihaagaddan Hooran||
translation: The mighty warrior Lakshman regained his senses and the roaming heavenly damsels went back;

gurmukhi: CwgVdMg CUty nwgVdMg nwdM ] bwgVdMg bwjy nwgVdMg nwdM ]586]
transliteration: Chhaadaddan Chhodhte Naagaddan Naadan|| Baagaddan Baaje Naagaddan Naadan||586||
translation: The great trumpets resounded in the battlefield.586.

gurmukhi: qwgVdMg qIrM CwgVdMg CUty ] gwgVdMg gwjI jwgVdMg juty ]
transliteration: Taagaddan Tderan Chhaadaddan Chhodhte|| Gadgaddan Gadjijaagaddan Joute||
translation: The arrows were discharged and the warriors began to fight again with one another.

gurmukhi: KwgVdMg KyqM swgVdMg soey ] pwgVdMg qy pwk swhId hoey ]587]
transliteration: Khadganndan Khetan Saagaddan Soe|| Paagaddan Te Paak Saaheed Hoe||587||
translation: The brave fighters dying in the battlefield became true martyrs.587.

gurmukhi: m`cy sUrbIr ibkRwrM ] n`cy BUq pRyq bYqwrM ]
transliteration: Machche Soorbeer Bikraaran|| Nachche Bhoot PrÃªt Baitaaran||
translation: The terrible warriors were absorbed in fighting the ghosts, fiends and Baitals began to dance;

gurmukhi: JmJm lsq koit vwrM ] JlhlMq au`jl As DwrM ]588]
transliteration: Jhamjham Lasat Kottee Kar Vaaran|| Jhal-halant Ujjal As Dhaaran||588||
translation: The blows were struck with many hands creating knocking sounds and the white edges of the swords glittered.588.

gurmukhi: au`jl As DwrM lsq ApwrM krx luJwrM Cib DwrM ] soiBq ijmu AwrM Aq Cib DwrM su bD suDwrM Ar gwrM ]
transliteration: Ujjal As Dhaaran Lasat Apaaran Karan Lujhaaran Chhab(i) Dhaaran|| Sobhit Jim(u) Aaran At Chhab(i) Dhaaran Su Bidh Sudhaaran Ar Gadran||
translation: The white edges of the swords, increasing splendour, looked impressive; these sword are the destroyers of the enemies and appear like saws;

gurmukhi: jYp`qRM dwqI midxM mwqI sRoxM rwqI jY krxM ] du`jn dl hMqI ACl jXMqI iklivK qI BY hrxM ]589]
transliteration: Jaipattran Daarimadinan Maatisronan Raatijai Karanan|| Dujjan Dal Hanti Achhal Jauantikilvikh Hantibhai Haranan||589||
translation: They frighten the enemy by granting victory, by bathing in the blood, by destroying the intoxicated tyrants and by perishing all the vices.589.
